_header: Love him both morrow and eve
_description: Inscriptions on the two halves of the open heart by an image of the God of Love in Athens — two couplets

Bod649.Transcription:
Loue him bothe morow and euefor loue is fresche and euer neweIn
                    wele and wo loue stondid fastfor lyue for deth loue wil last
Bod649.Note:
Line 1 appears first as ‘ffor and ne loue morw and eue’ but
                    is later repeated as given.
